SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column

Class ResourceRepresentation

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column.ColumnRepresentation
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column.ResourceRepresentation
public final class ResourceRepresentation extends ColumnRepresentation
Represents a FHIR resource at the root level of a flat schema dataset where top-level fields are accessed directly via col(fieldName) rather than through nested struct access.

This representation is used when generating SparkSQL Column expressions that work directly on Pathling-encoded flat datasets, eliminating the need for schema wrapping/unwrapping operations.

The representation holds an "existence column" (typically the id column) that can be used to check whether a resource exists. Key behaviors:

  • getValue() returns the existence column - this represents whether the resource exists (non-NULL for valid resources, NULL for empty collections)
  • existenceColumn returns the id column for existence checks
  • vectorize(UnaryOperator, UnaryOperator) applies the singular expression and returns a new ResourceRepresentation (resources are always singular)
  • flatten() returns this unchanged since resources are already flat
  • traverse(String) returns a DefaultRepresentation with col(fieldName) - subsequent traversals use getField()

Example column generation differences: 

 Expression          | Nested Schema                              | Resource (Flat) Schema
 --------------------|--------------------------------------------|--------------------------
 Patient.name        | col("Patient").getField("name")            | col("name")
 Patient.name.family | col("Patient").getField("name")            | col("name").getField("family")
                     |    .getField("family")                     |
Author:
Piotr Szul

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_EXISTENCE_COLUMN

      public static final String DEFAULT_EXISTENCE_COLUMN
      Default name for the existence column (resource id).
      See Also:

  • Method Details

    • of

      @Nonnull public static ResourceRepresentation of(@Nonnull Column existenceColumn)
      Creates a ResourceRepresentation with the specified existence column.
      Parameters:
      existenceColumn - the column representing resource existence (typically the id column)
      Returns:
      a new ResourceRepresentation

    • withIdColumn

      @Nonnull public static ResourceRepresentation withIdColumn()
      Creates a ResourceRepresentation using the standard id column as the existence column.

      This is the most common factory method for creating instances that work with standard Pathling-encoded flat datasets where col("id") represents resource existence.

      Returns:
      a new ResourceRepresentation with col("id") as existence column

    • alwaysPresent

      @Nonnull public static ResourceRepresentation alwaysPresent()
      Creates a ResourceRepresentation for contexts where each row represents exactly one resource.

      This factory method uses lit(true) as the existence column, meaning all field accesses are unconditional. This is appropriate for single-resource evaluation contexts where every row in the dataset represents a valid resource, even if the resource doesn't have an id element defined.

      Returns:
      a new ResourceRepresentation with lit(true) as existence column

    • getValue

      @Nonnull public Column getValue()
      Returns the existence column as the value for this representation.

      In flat schema, there is no single column representing the whole resource structure. However, the existence column (typically the id column) serves as a value that indicates whether the resource exists (non-NULL) or not (NULL). This is used when operations like asSingular() need to materialize a column value for the resource.

      Specified by:
      getValue in class ColumnRepresentation
      Returns:
      the existence column

    • copyOf

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation copyOf(@Nonnull Column newValue)
      Creates a copy of this representation with a new existence column value.
      Specified by:
      copyOf in class ColumnRepresentation
      Parameters:
      newValue - the new existence column value
      Returns:
      a new ResourceRepresentation with the specified column

    • vectorize

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation vectorize(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> arrayExpression, @Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> singularExpression)
      Applies the singular expression to the existence column and returns a new ResourceRepresentation.

      In flat schema, resources are inherently singular (one row = one resource), so the singular expression is always applied (not the array expression). The result is a new ResourceRepresentation with the transformed column, ensuring subsequent operations (like traverse(String)) continue to use ResourceRepresentation behavior.

      Specified by:
      vectorize in class ColumnRepresentation
      Parameters:
      arrayExpression - the expression to apply for array values (not used)
      singularExpression - the expression to apply for singular values
      Returns:
      a new ResourceRepresentation with the transformed existence column

    • flatten

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation flatten()
      Flattens this representation.

      Since flat schema representation is already "flat" (fields accessed directly as columns), this returns the representation unchanged. Operations that need a column value should traverse to a specific field first.

      Specified by:
      flatten in class ColumnRepresentation
      Returns:
      this ResourceRepresentation unchanged

    • traverse

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation traverse(@Nonnull String fieldName)
      Traverses from the root to a top-level field in the flat schema.

      Unlike nested schema traversal where we use col("ResourceType").getField(fieldName), this method creates a direct column reference using col(fieldName).

      When the existence column has been modified (e.g., via filtering with where()), the field access is conditional on the existence column being non-null. For the default case (existence column is col("id")), the field is accessed directly without additional null checks.

      The returned representation is a DefaultRepresentation, so subsequent traversals will use the standard getField() method for nested access.

      Specified by:
      traverse in class ColumnRepresentation
      Parameters:
      fieldName - the name of the field to traverse to
      Returns:
      a DefaultRepresentation wrapping the field access

    • traverse

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation traverse(@Nonnull String fieldName, @Nonnull Optional<Enumerations.FHIRDefinedType> fhirType)
      Traverses from the root to a top-level field in the flat schema, with FHIR type awareness.

      This method delegates to traverse(String) for the actual traversal, then applies type-specific handling for special FHIR types like base64Binary.

      Specified by:
      traverse in class ColumnRepresentation
      Parameters:
      fieldName - the name of the field to traverse to
      fhirType - the FHIR type of the field
      Returns:
      a ColumnRepresentation for the field, with appropriate type handling

    • getField

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation getField(@Nonnull String fieldName)
      Gets a top-level field from the flat schema without flattening.

      Similar to traverse(String) but does not apply removeNulls() or flatten(), preserving the nested structure of the field.

      Specified by:
      getField in class ColumnRepresentation
      Parameters:
      fieldName - the name of the field to get
      Returns:
      a DefaultRepresentation wrapping the field access
